thread.title: Wolves winger Jordan Graham extends Oxford loan
thread.title_full: Wolves winger Jordan Graham extends Oxford loan

title: Wolves winger Jordan Graham extends Oxford loan
text:
PUBLISHED: October 23, 2015 2:01 pm LAST UPDATED: October 23, 2015 5:15 pm Wolves winger Jordan Graham extends Oxford loan Wolves winger Jordan Graham has had a loan spell at Oxford United extended until the end of December. Jordan Graham scores in the pre-season win at Doncaster Rovers. Tweet 
Graham joined the League Two side earlier this month and has impressed in his early appearances. 
He has played five times for the U's and his last game was scheduled to be tomorrow against Barnet. 
But the former Villa man is now set to stay at the Kassam Stadium for at least two more months. 
Graham said earlier this week he was keen to make up for the red card he recently received against Leyton Orient, which meant he sat out Tuesday's victory over Plymouth. 
He told BBC Radio Oxford: "It's almost been the perfect month for me. 
"But, the sending off has made it a better loan really. 
"I'm better off learning things like this now when I'm still young than later in my career during an important cup final." 
"My dad told me these things happen to all players in football. 
"I just have to learn from it and make sure I don't put my teammates in a position like that again. 
"But, I'm really enjoying my time here. I've been playing well, we've been winning and everyone's happy. 
"I've spoken to Wolves about how much I've enjoyed it and I think the paperwork's being sorted to keep me here a bit longer." 
The 20-year-old has yet to feature in Wolves' first team. 
On the loan extension Graham tweeted to say: "Delighted to announce I am staying until the new year. Loving my time here, looking forward to tomorrow's game and hopefully another win!" 
Wolves have a 24-hour recall clause in the deal. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
